result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles E. Betties was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: On or Near a Park, Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g) [Modifiers: Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense, On or Near a School], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent. 
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
* Pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).
  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to Ct 1. 12-CF-714 & Milwaukee Co Case 98-CF-6627.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
* Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
* Pay DNA surcharges.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court reporter transcript invoice for sentencing 1/14/16  paid by county $46.00
1/14/16 - Sentencing Hearing
For Cts 2, 3 & 5 only - Dismissed and read in.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney A Komp.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On ct 1 the court imposes a total sentence of 9 years WSP consecutive to 12CF714 and Milwaukee County case 98CF6627; 4 years initial confinement; 5 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is not eligible for CIP; deft is eligible for SAP; on ct 4 the court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 4 years w/conditions consecutive to ct 1, 12CF714 and Milwaukee County case 98CF6627; pay $500 DNA surcharge during period of extended supervision.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney A Komp.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 2, 3 & 5 are dismissed and read in.  Deft pleads guilty to cts 1 & 4.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 1 & 4.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 1/14/16 at 2:15pm.  Bond continued.

With Atty Komp and ADA McNeill the PTC of 9/9/15 at 8:15am is rescheduled; as the deft has a revocation matter pending in another case and she would also like time to discuss resolution of this case w/ADA McNeill; reset to 10/28/15 at 1:15pm.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Defendant Charles E. Betties appeared with Attorney Angela Komp.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 6.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary Hearing Waiver/Plea Offer
to Preliminary Hearing

Clerk NJ  Preliminary Hearing set on 8/5/15 @ 930   before Comm Mason, 927-54th Street, Room 157, Kenosha, WI.  $25,000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  PO Hold.
